content.body:
Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/15129 — in general in MDN articles where we’re describing a case where some JavaScript data type gets coerced into another data type, any recommendations on what term we should use? _“an x gets cast to a y_”, or _“an x gets converted to a y”_, or _“an x gets coerced into a y”_? or what?
(this particular case is about the _delay_ parameter of `setTimeout()` being coerced into a number)

content.body: "coerced" is the term I personally use
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: "coerced" is the term I personally use

content.body: The spec doesn't use the verb "cast" at all.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: The spec doesn't use the verb "cast" at all.

content.body: this is also the word used in at least some education materials, looks like
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: this is also the word used in at least some education materials, looks like

content.body:
> <@jmdyck:matrix.org> The spec doesn't use the verb "cast" at all.

OK yeah then I think we should avoid “cast” in MDN

content.body:
e.g. https://eloquentjavascript.net/01_values.html

> When an operator is applied to the “wrong” type of value, JavaScript will quietly convert that value to the type it needs, using a set of rules that often aren’t what you want or expect. This is called type coercion.
content.formatted_body:
e.g. https://eloquentjavascript.net/01_values.html

When an operator is applied to the “wrong” type of value, JavaScript will quietly convert that value to the type it needs, using a set of rules that often aren’t what you want or expect. This is called type coercion.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
e.g. https://eloquentjavascript.net/01_values.html

> When an operator is applied to the “wrong” type of value, JavaScript will quietly convert that value to the type it needs, using a set of rules that often aren’t what you want or expect. This is called type coercion.

e.g. https://eloquentjavascript.net/01_values.html

When an operator is applied to the “wrong” type of value, JavaScript will quietly convert that value to the type it needs, using a set of rules that often aren’t what you want or expect. This is called type coercion.

content.body: It does use "coerce" some, but it uses "convert/conversion" a lot more.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It does use "coerce" some, but it uses "convert/conversion" a lot more.

content.body: though that's in a section called "automatic type conversion", not "... coercion", so somewhat inconsistent
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: though that's in a section called "automatic type conversion", not "... coercion", so somewhat inconsistent
